0: Start Upgrade.|1: Cancel Upgrade.|

menu2.name: CDS(DR100 State Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+ GTCDS is used for setting buzzer and LED state of DR100 Card Reader.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The ID which is unauthorized.|1: The ID which is authorized.
0: Disable this Output State.|1: Enable this Output State.
0: Disable Output State.|1: Enable Output State.

menu2.name: MCT(Multiple Command Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTMCT is used to transfer data between the device and the equipment connected through serial port.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable.|1: Enable.|

menu2.name: RCS (RS485 Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRCS is used to configure RS485 related settings for the device to be connected with multiple external devices via RS485.

menu3.Description: The index of the supported baud rate of the serial port.
The data bits of the UART. The parameter value can be 7 or 8.

menu3.RangeMx: 1:1 Stop bit|2:2 Stop bits|3:1.5 Stop bits|
menu3.Description: Stop bits of the UART. The parameter value can be 1, 2 or 3.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: None parity|1:Odd parity|2: Even parity|
menu3.Description: The parity bits of the UART. The parameter value can be 0, 1 or 2.

menu2.name: RAS (RS485 Accessory Setting)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRAS is used to configure RS485 accessory settings for the device to be connected with multiple external devices via RS485.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: No RS485 device.|1: UFS301 digital fuel sensor. | 2: Escort TD500 digital fuel sensor.| 3: Modbus communication equipment.|

menu3.Description: A list of RS485 Device ID to be updated to the Device ID list.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: The Optional Parameters do not exist.|13: The number of Optional Parameters is 13.|14: The number of Optional Parameters is 14.|
menu3.Description: The <Optional Parameter Number> is used to control the number of Optional Parameters.

menu3.RangeMx: 1: Read Data.|2: Write Data.|3: Read and Write Data.|
menu3.Description: The operating mode of Modbus feature.

menu3.RangeMx: Read Data Response Timeout.|Write Data Response Timeout.|Read Data Success.|Write Data Success.|Modbus Error.
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure which event report should be sent to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 1: Read Coils.|2: Read Discrete Inputs.|3: Read Holding Registers.|4: Read Input Registers.|
menu3.Description: The modbus function codes that are supported.

Time in milliseconds allowed by the Modbus Master for the slave to respond. If the slave does not respond within this time, the Modbus Master will retry the request or terminate the request with an error. The retry times is 2.

menu3.RangeMx: 5: Write Single Coil|6: Write Single Register|0F: Write Multiple Coils|10: Write Multiple registers
menu3.Description: The modbus function codes that are supported.

Time in milliseconds allowed by the Modbus Master for the slave to respond. If the slave does not respond within this time, the Modbus Master will retry the request or terminate the request with an error. The retry times is 2.
The content of data written by Master to Slave.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: RTU format.|1: ASCII format.

menu2.name: TPM(Tire Pressure Monitoring)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTTPM is used to configure the parameters of tire pressure monitoring system. the message +RESP:GTTMS will be reported to the backend server.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable the tire monitoring function.|1: Fixed Time Report.

menu2.name: FVR (Configuration File Version Record)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTFVR is used to record information of the configuration file generated by Manage Tool for AT+GTUPC.

menu3.Description: The name of the configuration file.
The version number of the configuration file. The first two characters indicate the major version number, and the last two characters indicate the minor version number.
It is used to confirm the validity of subsequent commands.
The time when the configuration file is generated.

menu2.name: UPC (Update Configuration)
menu2.Description2: The AT+GTUPC command is used to download configuration file over the air for the update of the local configuration.

menu3.Description: It specifies the maximum number of retries to download the configuration file upon download failure.
It specifies the expiration timeout of one download. If the download expires, it is considered to be failure.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: HTTP|
menu3.Description: The protocol used to download the file. Only HTTP is supported now. And it is set to 0.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable.|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate whether to report the message UPC (ASCII)/(HEX) , EUC (ASCII)/(HEX) when the configuration is updated over the air.
The interval for updating the configuration over the air.

It specifies the URL to download the configuration file. If <Download URL> ends with “/” which means the URL is just a path without file name, the <IMEI>.ini will be added as the default file name to complete the URL. If it is greater than 100 bytes in length, error will be returned.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Disable|1: Enable|
menu3.Description: A numeral that indicates the working mode of downloading configuration over the air.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: UPC.|1: EPC.|
menu3.Description: A numeral to indicate the message to be reported for the configuration update status when <Report Mode> is 1.
A numeral to identify the configuration update request. It will be included in the message +RESP:GTEUC to indicate the request it is related to.

menu3.RangeMx: Ignition Off|Ignition On|
menu3.Description: Bitwise mask to configure the status in which the device can update the configuration.

menu2.name: UPD(Firmware Update)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTUPD is used to start and stop the firmware update remotely.

menu3.RangeMx: 0:Start the Firmware Update|1:Stop the Firmware Update|
0: HTTP.|
0: BB firmware update.|1: MCU firmware.|4: BLE firmware update.|5: CAN Module firmware update.|6: UFS xxx fuel sensor update.|9: CAN Module configuration update.|10: THR_100 update.|
0:Report the +RESP:GTUPD message to indicate the firmware update status.|1:Report the +RESP:GTEUD message to indicate the firmware update status.|

menu2.name: RTO (Real Time Operation)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTRTO is used to retrieve information from the terminal or control the terminal when it executes certain actions.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Get the GNSS related information|1: RTL. Request the terminal to report its current position immediately |2: Get the current configuration of the terminal.|3: Reboot the terminal.|4: RESET. Reset all parameters to factory settings.|5: Power off the device.|6: Get the ICCID of the SIM card which is being used by the terminal|7: Get the current GSM signal level of the terminal |8: Get the version information of the device|9: Get the battery level and adapter status of the terminal.|A: Get status of all the IO ports.|B: Get the time zone settings |C: Get cell information.|D: Get APN, ICCID, base station ID, RSSI, cell ID, IP and DNS server |E: Request the device to report the GNSS satellites information.|10: Get CAN information.|11: Get the version number information of UFSxxx fuel sensor|12: Get the version number information of CAN Module.|13:Get the serial number information of CAN100 via the message +RESP:GTCSN.|14:Commands for Bluetooth|16: Get the device state|1B: Get the RS-232 connection status between AVL Reader and the device via +RESP:GTAVC.|1C:Get basic device information.|1D: Get DR100 accessory information.|1E:Get AU100 device information via the message +RESP:GTAUI.|22: Set car model for CAN Module or read car model from CAN Module.|25: Get the self-calibration status of the acceleration data .|27: Set the working mode for the RF433 accessories.|2B: Get the version number information of THR_100 .|2F: Query Mode. Query the information related to CAN and report them|31: Delete all the buffered reports.|38: Get the statistics of data usage |3A: Set the state of the WRL300.|3B: Query the GTINF.|3C: TPMS.|
menu3.Description: A HEX value which indicates the sub command of AT+GTRTO.

menu3.groupname: 0 - GNSS. Get the GNSS related information via the message +RESP:GTGPS.

menu2.name: SMS (SMS Text Sending)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSMS is used to send SMS text to a target phone number.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: ASCII Format|

menu2.name: SWL (SMS White List)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTSWL is used to configure a list of authorized phone numbers which are allowed to configure the device.

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Allow any phone number to configure the device. |1: Only phone numbers saved in the white list could configure the device. |

menu2.name: RTP (Remote File Transfer)

menu3.RangeMx: 0: Download File.|
0: HTTP.|
0: CA certificate.|1: Client Certificate.|2: Client key.|

menu2.name: LTP (Local File Transfer)
menu2.Description2: The command AT+GTLTP is used to write the file to the device by subcontracting.

0: CA certificate.|1: Client Certificate.|2: Client key.|

menu2.name: LBC (SMS Location Request)
menu2.Description2: This command can only be sent via SMS. The device will send SMS report with Google maps hyperlink and the current location to corresponding phone number or report LBC to the backend server immediately.
